title: Issue with labeling frames

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**

OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.4, using Anaconda
Browser: Firefox


**Describe the problem**
After running the basic setup code:
```
deeplabcut.create_new_project('test1','ab',[videos_folder+'p4.avi'])
deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path)
```
The extract frames command runs successfully
> Config file read successfully.
> Frames were selected.
> You can now label the frames using the function 'label_frames' (if you extracted enough frames for all videos).

However, once I run the label_frames command and select the videos folder to load the data from in the GUI, it gives the following error:
```
IndexError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
D:\Users\Aneesh Boreda\Anaconda3\envs\dlc-windowsGPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\labeling_toolbox.py in browseDir(self, event)
    464 
    465 # Reading the image name
--> 466         self.img = self.index[self.iter]
    467         img_name = Path(self.index[self.iter]).name
    468         self.norm,self.colorIndex = self.image_panel.getColorIndices(self.img,self.bodyparts)

IndexError: index 0 is out of bounds for axis 0 with size 0
```

Any help on how to fix this? I feel like I may be choosing the wrong folder when using load frames in the GUI.
